channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street cleaner missed our street, 19th November
item.description:
Perran Road and its pavements are full of rubbish. It appears as if the street cleaner in charge has missed our street recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perran Road, Tulse Hill, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown trees/ bushes, 19th November
item.description:
The whole corner garden is overgrown causing people to have to walk on to the grass just to get around the corner. Low hanging branches. Blocking the light.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middle Park Avenue, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Birkenhead St and St Chads St, 19th November
item.description:
The young tree at the junction of Birkenhead St and St Chad’s St, planted to replace a mature one that was cut down, has died. I don't know why. Can you replace it, and with something tough enough to make it to maturity?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Birkenhead Street, King's Cross, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste and litter overflowing, 19th November
item.description:
Shand street tunnel at the junction of Crucifix lane, SE13JW. This issue was reported yesterday and I am told after an investigation nothing was found to be wrong. I can only assume that’s no one attended. Please look at the photo and tell me if nothing seems wrong here?! There is waste and rubbish spilling out onto the street, food and mixed litter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arch 6, Crucifix Lane, The Borough, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti covered phone box and post box, 19th November
item.description:
Graffiti covered phone box and post box. On section of Clapham Road between Albert Square and Landsdowne Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Clapham Road, Stockwell, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging street and private drive, 19th November
item.description:
This large tree overhangs both the pavement and our driveway. Branches often fall and risk damaging our cars. We frequently have to pick them up from the pavement too, which is clearly a risk for pedestrians. To my knowledge this tree has not been cut back for several years and needs a good cut back to be safe for all concerned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

Dumped furniture

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Congo Road, Plumstead

item.title: Overhanging branches, 19th November
item.description:

item.title: Some rubbish was kept on top of the other bins and all the recylcled products were thrown on the floor, 19th November
item.description:
The bin were overflowing, kept rubbish on top of the closed bins and rubbish were thrown all over the place near acton mews.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Acton Mews, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped fence/construction rubbish, 19th November
item.description:
Rubbish dumped at park entrance on SE20 8QU, next to 6 Blean Grove for over a week. Please note that different kind of rubbish is often being dumped in this area of the park, next to residential property. The fence has been broken for quite a while and therefore often a spot used for fly tipping and disposing of materials. Please can this be removed. Can the fence area be repaired and maintained please so the issue can be avoided. Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blean Grove, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic lights here are all out, 19th November
item.description:
The traffic lights are not showing up in the traffic light colours there is no red or green man and the wait sign also will not light up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadway, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 19th November
item.description:
The broken bike has been abandoned for at least 4 weeks now. While this is a Dott bike, Dott no longer operates in London. The bike periodically gets moved from one side of the street to the other and is currently on Harmsworth Street near the junction of Sharsted Street. Registration is: CWX-KF1.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Harmsworth Street, Elephant and Castle, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cans and bottles dropped in alleyway, 19th November
item.description:
For the last month there have been cans and bottles and other rubbish dropped along the path between the station carpark and Sidcup road .The bin was removed so there is nowhere for rubbish yo go
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidcup Road, Eltham

item.title: Paving Barrier is broken, 19th November
item.description:
The paving stones have been decaying for several years and have been patched unsuccessfully. The mud is slowly spilling out onto the road. It is becoming a public danger and will block peoples exits.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: NW6 6BG in front of nos 1 to 101 Hartland Rd, 19th November
item.description:
As can be seen on pictures, loads of wet leaves everywhere i.e.on pavements and gutters, under cars and so on... We have to walk on street as it is so treacherous. Would you please kindly sweep ASAP. Thank you for your understanding and clearing of leaves.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bins full, 19th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cocksure Lane, North Cray, Foots Cray, London Borough of Bexley
